docs.lead_paragraph: It is perfectly fair to expect chain restaurants to know and share information about what they serve, especially for the sake of good health.
docs.snippet: It is perfectly fair to expect chain restaurants to know and share information about what they serve, especially for the sake of good health.

headline.main: How Would Merrill's Exit Affect Lower Manhattan?

docs.abstract: Also in the Morning Buzz: the burgeoning school-based environmental movement, a new effort at requiring restaurants to post calorie counts, a psychiatrist's lawsuit against Columbia University and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch & Company, the world's largest brokerage firm, appears ready to move its longtime headquarters from Lower Manhattan to a new skyscraper in Midtown, across Seventh Avenue from Pennsylvania Station, on the current site of the Hotel Pennsylvania. The move would be a blow to downtown and its supporters in Albany, including Gov. Eliot Spitzer, and it would hobble efforts to re-establish ground zero as a financial center. But it would be a major boost to the developer Steven Roth's ambitions for the Penn Station area, Charles V. Bagli reports.
docs.snippet: Also in the Morning Buzz: the burgeoning school-based environmental movement, a new effort at requiring restaurants to post calorie counts, a psychiatrist's lawsuit against Columbia University and more.

headline.sub: Measure Would Affect Many Chain Restaurants;
headline.print_headline: New York City Reintroduces Calorie Rule
headline.main: New York City Reintroduces Calorie Rule

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration reintroduced an effort Wednesday to force chain restaurants to display calorie information on their menus or menu boards, after a federal judge struck down a similar measure last month.
docs.snippet: The Bloomberg administration reintroduced an effort Wednesday to force chain restaurants to display calorie information on their menus or menu boards, after a federal judge struck down a similar measure last month.

headline.main: Across the River: 2 Divergent Paths in Southeast Asia

docs.lead_paragraph: The Moei River separating Myanmar from Thailand also symbolizes a wider, more basic gulf between the nations: major disparities in health, well-being and prosperity.

headline.main: City Tries Again With Labeling Fast-Food Menus

docs.abstract: Health officials proposed a new regulation requiring chain restaurants to post calorie information on their menus. A federal judge struck down an earlier plan.
docs.lead_paragraph: City health officials, in their continuing fight against obesity, proposed a new regulation today requiring chain restaurants to post calorie information on their menus after a federal judge struck down a similar measure in September.The new regulation would apply to all restaurants with 15 outlets or more across the country, though it's aimed squarely at the fast food industry. Many chains, like McDonald's, Burger King and Starbucks, already provide calorie information on their Web sites, or on posters or tray liners available in their restaurants. But health officials say customers rarely see this information before deciding what to order.
docs.snippet: Health officials proposed a new regulation requiring chain restaurants to post calorie information on their menus. A federal judge struck down an earlier plan.

headline.print_headline: Sales Are Strong for Glaxo’s Weight-Loss Product
headline.main: Sales Are Strong for Glaxo’s Weight-Loss Product

docs.lead_paragraph: Desperate for a cure for fat, consumers have purchased more than two million starter packages of the new weight-loss product Alli since it launched four months ago.
docs.snippet: Desperate for a cure for fat, consumers have purchased more than two million starter packages of the new weight-loss product Alli since it launched four months ago.

headline.main: At Every Age, Feeling the Effects of Too Little Sleep

docs.lead_paragraph: Even toddlers don’t get enough rest, but the real agony starts in the teens.
